Container.Name: phev2mqtt
Container.Overview:
MQTT gateway for Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV - Monitor and control your PHEV remotely via MQTT
This container connects to your Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV via WiFi and provides MQTT integration for home automation systems like Home Assistant. Designed to work with a MikroTik WiFi client bridge (RBSXTsq2nD) on a separate VLAN for stable connectivity.
Features: Remote climate control, battery status monitoring, charging status, door lock control, and more.
CONFIGURATION: All settings are configured via .env file in the mapped /config folder. On first start, an example .env file will be created automatically. Edit it with your MQTT credentials and restart the container.
Requires NET_ADMIN capability for network routing. Configure your MikroTik router according to the documentation.
GitHub: https://github.com/stefanh12/phev2mqtt

Config.Name: Config Folder
Config.Description: Configuration folder - An example .env file will be created here on first start. Edit /config/.env with your MQTT credentials (server, user, password) and other settings, then restart the container.
